title: National-level shooter sexually harassed on bus by drivers, conductor in Indore
text:
The woman alerted the police to the matter when the bus was stopped during a routine night patrol.

The Madhya Pradesh Police arrested three men, including two bus drivers, for allegedly sexually harassing a woman, who is a national-level shooter, in Indore.

According to police, the incident occurred on the night of November 16 aboard a private bus. The accused, drivers Arvind Verma (35) and Paramendra Gautam (52), along with the driver’s assistant Deepak Malviya (27), were reportedly intoxicated when they repeatedly approached the woman’s seat and allegedly touched her inappropriately despite her protests.
